Prabowo Akan Kaji Kelanjutan Pengembangan Jet Tempur RI-Korsel
05 Nov 2019, 21:29 by Lisye Sri Rahayu
Jakarta - Wakil Menteri Pertahanan (Wamenhan) Wahyu Sakti Trenggono menyebut Menteri Pertahanan (Menhan) Prabowo Subianto akan mengkaji kelanjutan kerja sama pengembangan pesawat tempur Korean Fighter Xperiment/Indonesia Fighter Xperiment (KFX/IFX). Trenggono menilai kerja sama dengan Korea Selatan tersebut harus memiliki manfaat yang jelas bagi industri pertahanan Indonesia.
"Cuma kita khusus KFX/IFX itu kita sedang dalamilah, kita pelajari. Sebetulnya manfaatnya kita dapat apa juga, itu kan penting," ujar Trenggono di kompleks Kementerian Pertahanan, Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa (5/11/2019).
"Iya (dikaji Prabowo), pasti," tegasnya.
Trenggono menilai pengadaan pesawat tempur tersebut menggunakan teknologi tinggi. Maka itu, teknologi juga akan diikuti kemampuan pertahanan Indonesia.
"Karena itu kan teknologi tinggi. Teknologi tinggi, pesawat tempur itu tidak sembarangan juga. Nah di level mana kita nanti dan kita sampai punya kemampuan seperti apa, itu juga," kata Trenggono.
Selain memahami teknologi yang digunakan dalam pesawat tempur tersebut, Trenggono menyebut pihaknya tengah mengkaji biaya kerja sama itu. Menurutnya, pengadaan KFX/IFX itu memakan biaya yang tinggi.
"Karena nilainya mahal. Kalian tahu nilainya berapa? Sampai 2 miliar dolar Amerika lo," ungkapnya.
Dengan demikian, Trenggono belum memastikan apakah kerja sama tersebut akan dilanjutkan. Menurutnya, perlu kajian mendalam untuk memutuskan kelanjutan kerja sama tersebut.
"Belum bisa menjawab saya karena perlu kajian dulu. Nanti kalau saya jawab kalian ini apa namanya, dilanjutkan atau dihentikan, heboh lagi. Masih dikaji dulu," imbuhnya.
Diketahui, proyek KFX/IFX diinisiasi pihak Korea Selatan. Indonesia menyatakan minat untuk ikut serta pada 2009, yang ditandai dengan penandatangan letter of intent (LoI). Kemudian, LoI ini berlanjut dengan kesepakatan pengembangan bersama.
Rencananya, pesawat tersebut akan diproduksi sebanyak 168 unit dengan pembagian Korsel 120 unit dan Indonesia diperkirakan 48 unit. Produksi massal rencananya dimulai pada 2026.

Prabowo Will Study Continuation of RI-South Korea Combat Jet Development
05 Nov 2019, 21:29 by Lisye Sri Rahayu
Jakarta - Deputy Minister of Defense (Wamenhan) Wahyu Sakti Trenggono said the Minister of Defense (Minister of Defense) Prabowo Subianto will examine the continued cooperation in the development of Korean Fighter Xperiment / Indonesian Fighter Xperiment (KFX / IFX) fighter planes. Trenggono assessed that cooperation with South Korea must have clear benefits for the Indonesian defense industry.
"We are only specialized in KFX / IFX, we are in the process, we study. Actually, the benefits we get are also important," said Trenggono at the Ministry of Defense complex, Jalan Medan Merdeka Barat, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019) .
"Yes (studied by Prabowo), for sure," he said.
Trenggono rate the procurement of fighter aircraft using high technology. Therefore, technology will also be followed by Indonesia's defense capability.
"Because it is high technology. High technology, the fighter is not haphazard too. Now at what level will we come and we will have what kind of ability, that too," said Trenggono.
In addition to understanding the technology used in the fighter plane, Trenggono said his office was reviewing the cost of the cooperation. According to him, the procurement of KFX / IFX is a high cost.
"Because the value is expensive. Do you know what the value is? Up to 2 billion US dollars," he said.
Thus, Trenggono has not confirmed whether the cooperation will continue. According to him, it needs an in-depth study to decide the continuation of the cooperation.
"Not yet able to answer me because it needs a study first. Later if I answer you what is the name, continued or stopped, excited again. Still under review first," he added.
It is known, the KFX / IFX project was initiated by South Korea. Indonesia expressed interest in participating in 2009, which was marked by the signing of a letter of intent (LoI). Then, the LoI continues with a joint development agreement.
The plan, the aircraft will be produced as many as 168 units with 120 units of South Korea and Indonesia estimated at 48 units. Mass production is planned to begin in 2026.
